activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damont Lashawn Peacock

defendant.name: Peacock, Damont Lashawn
defendant.address: 4216 S County Road D, Janesville, WI 53548

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on January 5, 2023 at 08:30 am.

1:06 PM Defendant Damont Lashawn Peacock appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Damont Lashawn Peacock.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Peter Cronin sworn in and testified by video. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:39 PM Defendant Damont Lashawn Peacock appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Damont Lashawn Peacock.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on August 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Damont Lashawn Peacock appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video for Damont Lashawn Peacock.  Waiting for public defender to appoint attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

12:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Damont Lashawn Peacock appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Damont Lashawn Peacock.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  $500.00 cash bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance on August 16, 2022 at 3pm.
